results.name: Table of coefficients of polynomials P(n,x) defined by the relation P(n,x) = (1+x)*P(n-1,x) + (-x)^(n+1).
comment: Values generate solutions to the recurrence a(n) = a(n-1) + k(k+1)* a(n-2), a(0)=1, a(1) = k(k+1)+1. Values and sequences associated with this table are included in A072024.
link: G. C. Greubel, Rows n = 0..100 of coefficients, flattened
formula: The polynomials P(n,-x), n > 0, satisfy a Riemann hypothesis: their zeros lie on the vertical line Re x = 1/2 in the complex plane.

T(n,k) = if(k<=2*floor((n+1)/2), Sum_{j=0..floor((n+1)/2)} binomial(n-2j,k-2j), 0). - _Paul Barry_, Apr 08 2011 (This formula produces the odd numbered rows correctly, but not the even. - _G. C. Greubel_, Feb 22 2019)
example: Rows are {1}, {1,1,1}, {1,2,2}, {1,3,4,2,1}, {1,4,7,6,3}, ... This is the same as table A035317 with an extra 1 at the end of every second row.
mathematica: Table[CoefficientList[Series[((1+x)^(n+2) -(-1)^n*x^(n+2))/(1+2*x), {x, 0, n+2}], x], {n, 0, 10}]//Flatten (* _G. C. Greubel_, Feb 18 2019 *)
xref: Similar to the triangles A059259, A035317, A108561, A112555. Cf. A059260.
